title: Day 1315
content:
# Day 1315

There is more magic in the world than we want to believe.
Or maybe it's better to say, more than most NPCs believe.

If you're reading this, you're probably not one of them ;p
Glazing the reader aside, even NPCs can become playable. 
They just have to lean into the magic.
Funny how that works.

A recent example: my father had a dream.
He told me, on Wednesday, that my son would be born on Friday.
He said it casually; like it was already written.
Sure enough, Friday came, and so did my son.

Now, you can shrug that off as coincidence.
You can summon your inner Reddit fact-checker and call it confirmation bias.
But maybe, just maybe, the rational mind isn't the only receiver of truth.

When my dad told me, the logical part of me dismissed it.
I said, "Nah, he'll be born tomorrow." (What would have been Thursday)
But the older part of me, the one that still prays, the one that feels instead of calculates knew better.
We mustn't be so quick to ignore divine intuition.

The Alpha and the Omega.
The King of Kings.
The Creator of everything.
You really think He can't whisper something like that into a Grandfather's dream?

[Even the Soviet Union, the most materialist regime in history, 
funded parapsychology research for decades.
They tried to measure telepathy, psychokinesis, and remote viewing.
The CIA did too.](https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP96-00792R000600350001-3.pdf)
Governments, scientists, spooks, all poking at the same mystery: 
that human consciousness might reach further than flesh and bone.

Magic, God, intuition, coincidence,
these are often different names for the same shimmer underneath reality.

So yeah, maybe there is more magic in the world than we want to believe.
Maybe the NPC inside each of us just needs to remember how to play again.

And beware of who you choose to love,
because love is the oldest magic of all.

It's what God had when he said FIAT LUX!

![Let There Be Light!](https://miro.medium.com/1*EsIrN33f0itjolzc2Jy-eg.png)

10/27/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
